alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 2:27PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gulf, southwestern Liberty and northwestern Franklin Counties through 315 PM EDT/215 PM CDT/... At 227 PM EDT/127 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southeast of Wewahitchka, or 17 miles north of Eastpoint, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orange, Wewahitchka, Honeyville, Buck Siding, Morgan Place, Vilas, Chipola Cutoff, Jensen Place, Central City, Beverly, Red Hill, Owens Bridge, Kern, Wilma, Lewis, Sumatra, Howard Creek, Willis Landing, Nixon Garden and Twin Pole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty
